top_stories.title: China and India pledge to be 'partners not rivals'
top_stories.description: Xi Jinping and Narendra Modi met on the sidelines of a summit which Russia's Vladimir Putin is also attending.

top_stories.title: Reeling from Trump's tariffs, India and China seek a business reboot
top_stories.description: India's prime minister hopes to draw nearer to some of the world’s largest economies.

top_stories.title: Thousands attend Australia anti-immigration rallies
top_stories.description: March for Australia rallies were condemned by the centre-left government as "spreading hate".

top_stories.title: Houthis confirm their prime minister killed in Israeli strike
top_stories.description: Ahmed Ghaleb Nasser al-Rahawi and several other Houthi officials were killed in the attack, the Iran-backed movement says.

top_stories.title: Prominent Ukrainian politician Andriy Parubiy shot dead in Lviv
top_stories.description: President Zelensky said the killing of Parubiy was a "terrible murder" - with a manhunt under way.

quick_reads.title: French voice fears over Bayeux Tapestry move to UK
quick_reads.description: The precious medieval work is to be displayed in London next year - but the French art world is strongly opposed.

quick_reads.title: Thousands demonstrate across Mexico for the 130,000 missing
quick_reads.description: Thousands march through Mexico's cities urging more government action against enforced disappearances - a problem often linked to drug cartels.

quick_reads.title: Chicago mayor signs order to resist potential Trump crackdown
quick_reads.description: The order is the latest chapter in an escalating feud between the White House and Illinois state officials over violent crime and immigration.

quick_reads.title: Russia launches massive attack on Ukraine, as Kyiv hits oil refineries
quick_reads.description: Russia hits 14 Ukrainian regions, Kyiv says, with at least one person reported killed and 30 injured.

quick_reads.title: Three dead after protests over death of taxi driver in Indonesia
quick_reads.description: The demonstrations - which also focus on cost-of-living and politicians expenses - are seen as a key test for President Prabowo Subianto.

top_stories.title: Nvidia says two mystery customers accounted for 39% of Q2 revenue
top_stories.description: Nearly 40% of Nvidia’s second quarter revenue came from just two companies, identified in a filing as "Customer A" and "Customer B."

top_stories.title: Taco Bell is having second thoughts about relying on AI at the drive-through
top_stories.description: Taco Bell has apparently rolled out voice AI-powered ordering at more than 500 drive-throughs, leading to unflattering viral moments like someone ordering 18,000 water cups in order to “bypass” the AI and get connected to a human server.

top_stories.title: The fall of EV startup Fisker: A comprehensive timeline
top_stories.description: Here is a timeline of the events that led fledgling automaker Fisker to file for bankruptcy.

top_stories.title: I’m really impressed with this $400 portable projector
top_stories.description: Projectors have come a long way and this portable one from Lumi offers impressive features, like Google TV and an obstacle avoidance function.

top_stories.title: Texas suit alleging anti-coal “cartel” of top Wall Street firms could reshape ESG
top_stories.description: It’s a closely watched test of whether corporate alliances on climate efforts violate antitrust laws.

top_stories.title: CDC asks all staff to return to office Sept. 15, five weeks after shooting at headquarters
top_stories.description: The internal announcement comes at a tumultuous time for the CDC and its workforce, which is still reeling from the shooting on Aug. 8.

top_stories.title: From ‘cheap food and curry houses’ to upscale dining: The rise of Indian restaurants in the U.S.
top_stories.description: Upscale Indian dining in the U.S. has seen a recent boom with restaurants like Semma and Bungalow riding the wave of increased interest in global cuisine.

top_stories.title: Retail panic: What the end of the 'de minimis' exemption means for brands across the globe
top_stories.description: The de minimis exemption, an obscure trade law provision, came to an end globally on Friday, setting off a panic across the retail industry.
